Detailed Description

< QWidgets++ - The C++ Class Library for the Photon microGUI
Parameters:
Author:   Markus Loffler Start Date: 8/6/98

Module: CFileSelect.hpp Description: CFileSelect class header file Implements a class for a fileselect box, based on the Photon function PtFileSelection()

Definition at line 19 of file CFileSelect.hpp.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CFileSelect::CFileSelect ( CWidget * parent = 0 )
 

!!! The CFileSelect object is not a widget in the widget hierarchy, even if a parent is set. It won't be deleted automatically when the parent is destroyed. It has to be deleted explicitely with the delete operator

CFileSelect::~CFileSelect ( )
 

!!! The CFileSelect object is not a widget in the widget hierarchy, even if a parent is set. It won't be deleted automatically when the parent is destroyed. It has to be deleted explicitely with the delete operator

Member Function Documentation

void CFileSelect::setPos ( int x,
int y )
 

Sets the position of the fileselect box This is relative to the parent, if a parent is specified, otherwise relative to the screen Default: Center

void CFileSelect::setTitle ( char * title )
 

The dialog's title. If 0, the string File Selector is used. Default: 0

void CFileSelect::setCurrentPath ( char * cuGLrrentPath )
 

The path the fileselect box starts with Default: "/"

char * CFileSelect::getCurrentPath ( )
 

Returns the current path

void CFileSelect::setCurrentPathToCurrentDirectory ( )
 

Sets the path the fileselect box starts with to the current directory path

void CFileSelect::setFileSpecification ( char * fileSpecification )
 

The file specification to look for. The default is * if this parameter is 0.

void CFileSelect::setButtonText ( char * openButtonText,
char * cancelButtonText )
 

Sets the text for the two buttons that appear in the fileselect box. Set the pointers to 0 for default text Default: Open, Cancel

void CFileSelect::setFormat ( char * format )
 

A string that's used to set the order and amount of file information displayed and optionally the initial size (in pixels) of each column shown. The following information can be displayed for each item in the widget by including the corresponding letter: To display: Specify: n name s size (in bytes) k size (in kbytes) d date p permissions o owner g group

If you don't want the divide shown, pass 0 as this parameter, and only the filenames are be displayed.

Default: 0

void CFileSelect::setFlags ( int flags )
 

Flags for the dialog. The default is to show all information, and corresponds to a value of 0. The possible values are: Pt_FSDIALOG_NO_FCHECK - don't check files for validity. This is good for a Save dialog. Pt_FSDIALOG_NO_FSPEC - don't display the File Spec widget. Pt_FSDIALOG_NO_UP_BUTTON - disables the display of the Up Directory button. Pt_FSDIALOG_SHOW_HIDDEN - shown hidden files. Default: 0

void CFileSelect::setKeepSelectedPathOn ( )
 

void CFileSelect::setKeepSelectedPathOff ( )
 

int CFileSelect::isKeepSelectedPath ( )
 

If on, the fileselector will appear with the latest selected path (default: on)

char * CFileSelect::getFileName ( )
 

Returns the selected filename including complete path

int CFileSelect::isCancelled ( )
 

int CFileSelect::displayAndProcess ( )
 

Displays the fileselect box and let the user select files
